question.text:
Observe the diagram given below.



Which of the following is a correct match?

options.text: A: Pigmented and opaque structure, B: The layer made up of dense, connective tissue
B: The layer which has photoreceptor cells, C: The second cranial nerve
C: The third cranial nerve, D: The central pit present in macula lutea
A: Transparent and pigmented structure, D: The central pit present in macula lutea

solution.text:
A: Cornea: Part where the image perceived by the eye is formed. B: Retina: The innermost layer of eye which contains the photoreceptor cells i.e. rods and cones.
C: Optic nerve: The second cranial nerve which is sensory in function.
D: Fovea: The central pit which is present in a yellow pigmented spot called macula lutea.
